alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 5:12PM PST until January 11 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Salinas River near Bradley affecting Monterey County. For the SALINAS RIVER...including Bradley, Spreckels...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salinas River near Bradley. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...Minor lowland flooding is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM PST Wednesday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM PST Wednesday was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river has fallen below flood stage but the river level remains elevated and hazardous. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.4 feet on 01/14/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM PST.
